output.conclusion: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of electromagnetic fields, equipping experts with the knowledge and tools to tackle advanced problems in electromagnetics and related fields.
output.courseTitle: Electromagnetic Fields: Advanced Concepts and Applications
output.introduction: Welcome to the advanced course on Electromagnetic Fields. This course delves into the intricacies of electromagnetism, building upon foundational knowledge to explore advanced concepts and real-world applications. Designed for experts, this course will challenge your understanding and enhance your problem-solving skills in this critical area of physics and engineering.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 1: Review of Vector Calculus and Coordinate Systems
chapters.description: A concise review of vector algebra, vector calculus (gradient, divergence, curl), and orthogonal coordinate systems (Cartesian, cylindrical, spherical). Emphasis on applications in electromagnetics.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 1: Electrostatics: Coulomb's Law and Electric Field
chapters.description: Revisiting Coulomb's Law, electric field intensity, electric flux density, Gauss's Law, and applications to charge distributions.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 1: Electrostatics: Electric Potential and Energy
chapters.description: Electric potential, potential gradient, equipotential surfaces, energy density in electrostatic fields, and capacitance calculations.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 2: Magnetostatics: Biot-Savart Law and Ampere's Law
chapters.description: Biot-Savart Law, magnetic field intensity, Ampere's Law, magnetic flux density, and applications to current distributions.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 2: Magnetostatics: Magnetic Vector Potential and Inductance
chapters.description: Magnetic vector potential, Stokes' Theorem, inductance calculations for various geometries, and energy stored in magnetic fields.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 2: Magnetic Materials and Boundary Conditions
chapters.description: Magnetization, magnetic susceptibility, permeability, magnetic boundary conditions, and applications in magnetic circuits.
Faraday's Law, displacement current, Maxwell's equations in differential and integral forms, and their physical significance.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 3: Electromagnetic Waves: Wave Propagation in Free Space
chapters.description: Wave equation, plane wave solutions, polarization, energy and momentum of electromagnetic waves, and Poynting vector.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 3: Electromagnetic Waves: Wave Propagation in Materials
chapters.description: Wave propagation in lossy dielectrics, conductors, skin depth, and wave impedance.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 4: Transmission Lines: Theory and Applications
chapters.description: Transmission line parameters, characteristic impedance, reflection coefficient, standing wave ratio, and impedance matching techniques.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 4: Transmission Lines: Smith Chart and Applications
chapters.description: Smith chart, impedance transformation, admittance calculations, and applications in microwave circuits.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 4: Waveguides: Rectangular and Circular Waveguides
chapters.description: Waveguide modes, cutoff frequencies, wave impedance, power transmission, and applications in microwave systems.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 5: Antennas: Radiation Principles and Characteristics
chapters.description: Antenna parameters (radiation pattern, gain, directivity, impedance), dipole antennas, and antenna arrays.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 5: Antennas: Antenna Arrays and Applications
chapters.description: Array factor, beam steering, pattern synthesis, and applications in wireless communication systems.

chapters.chapterTitle: Module 5: Computational Electromagnetics: Introduction to Numerical Methods
chapters.description: Introduction to Finite Difference Time Domain (FDTD) and Finite Element Method (FEM) for solving electromagnetic problems.
